text: as an international student I think I'm
really glad uh that I was here for the
pre-mba program that was hosted for us
in 2007 uh was my first time that I
actually came to the US and naturally
was a bit um apprehensive about uh how
it was going to be especially I think
the name Harvard has a lot of pressure
on students to really like do well um so
what what I think what pmba did for me
was like really kind of facilitated my
uh smooth flow into the HBS um
uh learning model and the community and
I think was really helpful in the first
uh couple of months kind of
integrating uh yourself uh with life uh
in Boston life in the US um and just a
very different learning model which is
the case method um even more exciting
was the fact that you get to be with um
with I in in my opinion the coolest
crowd of the of um of HBS which is the

think we had roughly 70 students um in
in my class that uh were enrolled for
the PRM program and we ended up being uh
very close uh there were people from
China from
Russia um from South America I I was the
only one from Pakistan so for me it was
really like an enlightening experience
to um get to know so many International
students uh who had had um experiences
in many different parts of the world not
necessarily in the us uh and I did end
up being like good friends with many of
them and until date I think they serve
as a very good network uh for myself um
at HBS I think the pre uh MBA staff is
truly commendable uh I think um uh I'm I
I really admire the efforts that um
folks like Moren Walker and Joyce uh put
together and like really making the MBA
uh the pre-mba program a real success uh
it was also great to have a lot lot of
international professors who came to
class not only taught us um cases from
different subjects but also gave us
their personal perspectives on how uh
they transitioned from their respective
countries and ended up in the United
States and um end up teaching in one of
the best universities of the world uh
because the class overall is really
diverse uh in terms of nationalities as
well um and in terms of functional
experiences um I think the HBS
experience really enables you to uh
appreciate and admire the the value of
having uh a diverse set of opinions on
the table and to be able to draw on from
those various opinions and make uh an
objective uh decision I think the HBS
experience has really changed my
thinking about leadership so that uh
when I'm responsible for making business
decisions tomorrow in my own capacity I
think those three lenses that we uh we
were taught during our course of on
leadership and corporate accountability
will always be kind of my um my guidance
in sort of forming my decisions so I
will not only want my business to
perform well from the economic point of
view but definitely legally and I think
most importantly ethically as well and I
think overall HBS prepares you to become
